column4: is there another type of driver I can use for the i350 printer as there is no linux drivers for it except turbo print that charges
Rayen> cna boot managers even do that, Im sure they are just there to boot the OS
is it me or macromedia flash which is installed by automatix doesn't get picked up by Opera
how can I get opera to pick up macromedia flash?
Ok, here's what you do, if you have flash-plugin installed for firefox
All you need to do is like the libflashplugin.so from /usr/lib/firefox/plugin to /usr/lib/opera/plugin/
Have you installed the flash-plugin for firefox yet?
IF SO! Do this, "cd /usr/lib/opera" and run "sudo ln -s /usr/lib/firefox/plugins/libflashplugin.so"
IF SO! Do this, "cd /usr/lib/opera/plugins/" and run "sudo ln -s /usr/lib/firefox/plugins/libflashplugin.so"
Ok, that should do the job :)
Yes, i know... Thats why you install the plugin in the /usr/lib/firefox/plugins folder
So have you installed the flashplugin for Firefox?
Thats all i need to know, so if you ran "ls -l /usr/lib/firefox*/plugins/" could you see a file called "libflashplugin.so" inside?
However, i assume the file is there... Now cd to /usr/lib/opera/plugins and run this "ln -s /usr/lib/firefox/plugins/libflashplayer.so"
You're supposed to "sudo" it... "sudo ln -s /usr/lib/firefox/plugins/libflashplayer.so", Sorry i didn't clarify that XD
